t: Now*p the word of the Lord*s came to Jonah the second time, saying,
“Arise, go to Nineveh, that great city, and preach to it the message that I tell you.”
So Jonah arose and went to Nineveh, according to the word of the Lord.*s Now Nineveh was an exceedingly great city, a three-day journey in*i extent.*i
And Jonah began to enter the city on the first day’s walk. Then he cried out and said, “Yet forty days, and Nineveh shall be overthrown!”
So*p the people of Nineveh believed God, proclaimed a fast, and put on sackcloth, from the greatest to the least of them.
Then word came to the king of Nineveh; and he arose from his throne and laid aside his robe, covered himself*i with sackcloth and sat in ashes.

And he caused it*i to be proclaimed and published throughout Nineveh by the decree of the king and his nobles, saying, Let*pn neither man nor beast, herd nor flock, taste anything; do not let them eat, or drink water.
But let man and beast be covered with sackcloth, and cry mightily to God; yes, let every one turn from his evil way and from the violence that is in his hands.
Who can tell if*i God will turn and relent, and turn away from His fierce anger, so that we may not perish?
Then*p God saw their works, that they turned from their evil way; and God relented from the disaster that He had said He would bring upon them, and He did not do it.
